oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Eighth Street Missionary Baptist Church, 2002 January
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of Eighth Street Missionary Baptist Church in Nashville, Tennessee. Built by Reverend R.L. Watson in 1945, this church building initially housed First Emmanuel Church. The Eighth Street Baptist Church was organized in 1913. In the 1950s the congregation moved to this church, located at 1223 Sixth Avenue North. Foundation materials include cut limestone and concrete blocks painted brown. Exterior walls are concrete blocks painted tan. Doors are made of wood. Roof materials consist of gabled tar shingles. Windows are a mix of frosted glass and arched, clear glass. Originally this church had a steeple. Forms part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. Sacred Sites Survey Project. 1 photograph : col. ; 4 x 6 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Eighth Street Missionary Baptist Church (Nashville, Tenn.); First Emmanuel Church (Nashville, Tenn.)
